CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - domestic and Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant retired from his post in ORG ( hereafter “ the Police Department ” ) . Having received no redundancy pay , to which he was entitled , the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG , seeking the recovery of the debt .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG awarded the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in redundancy pay arrears . On DATE , ORG ( hereafter “ the Court of Appeal ” ) , on ORG appeal , re - examined the case and upheld this judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( hereafter “ the Bailiffs’ Service ” ) instituted enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of DATE and joined the applicant ’s case to other enforcement actions against the debtor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Bogunsky ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint about the GPE inactivity . The court stated that in DATE , acting in the course of the enforcement proceedings to which the applicant ’s case was subsequently joined , ORG levied ORG bank account , which revealed no funds suitable for attachment . The court found that no further actions regarding ORG account were possible in the absence of budgetary funds earmarked for such purposes . This judgment was upheld by ORG on DATE and by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , on ORG request , temporarily suspended the enforcement proceedings . On DATE ORG quashed this decision as it was taken in the applicant ’s absence and manifestly unfounded . On DATE the ORG ultimately rejected ORG request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the enforcement proceedings as the judgment of DATE had been enforced in full .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is set out in the judgment of DATE in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . PERSON , § § CARDINAL ) .
